name: Path T Lacrimal Gland
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:** Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for lacrimal gland tumors.

**Note 2:** Tumors greater than 2 cm (the size of the lacrimal gland) usually extend into the orbital soft tissue.

**Note 3:** Periosteum is a fibrous membrane that wraps the outer surface of bones.

**Note 4:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 5:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Extension to any of the following WITHOUT bone invasion:
     Globe (eyeball)
     Optic nerve
     Orbital soft tissues

    Confined to lacrimal gland
    Localized, NOS
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Surgical resection of primary tumor done, size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary

Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
LIMITED to the lacrimal gland

Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension
LIMITED to the lacrimal gland

Tumor more than 4 cm OR 
WITH extraglandular extension into orbital soft tissue, including optic nerve or globe
Tumor invades periosteum or orbital bone or adjacent structures

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a, T4b and T4c. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Stated as T4 [NOS]

Tumor invades adjacent structures: 
    Brain
    Sinus
    Pterygoid fossa
    Temporal fossa

Pathologic T is not defined for the specific site/histology
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
